p: The virus was first identified in the State Serum Institute in Copenhagen, Denmark, in 1958 during an investigation into a pox-like disease among monkeys. Monkeypox virus is pathogenic for both animals and humans: Human monkeypox infection was first identified in 1970 in a 9 month old child in the town of Basankusu, Equateur Province, Democratic Republic of Congo and initially NHP were suspected as the source of outbreaks (Ladnyj et al. 1972; Marrennikova et al. 1972).
